PropertySetDef.Name: Pset_TransformerTypeCommon
PropertySetDef.Definition: Definition from IAI: An inductive stationary device that transfers electrical energy from one circuit to another.

PropertyDef.Name: PrimaryVoltage
PropertyDef.Definition: The voltage that is going to be transformed and that runs into the transformer on the primary side.

PropertyDef.Name: SecondaryVoltage
PropertyDef.Definition: The voltage that has been transformed and is running out of the transformer on the secondary side.

PropertyDef.Name: PrimaryCurrent
PropertyDef.Definition: The current that is going to be transformed and that runs into the transformer on the primary side.

PropertyDef.Name: SecondaryCurrent
PropertyDef.Definition: The current that has been transformed and is running out of the transformer on the secondary side.

PropertyDef.Name: PrimaryFrequency
PropertyDef.Definition: The frequency that is going to be transformed and that runs into the transformer on the primary side.

PropertyDef.Name: SecondaryFrequency
PropertyDef.Definition: The frequency that has been transformed and is running out of the transformer on the secondary side.

PropertyDef.Name: PrimaryApparentPower
PropertyDef.Definition: The power in VA (volt ampere) that has been transformed and that runs into the transformer on the primary side.

PropertyDef.Name: SecondaryApparentPower
PropertyDef.Definition: The power in VA (volt ampere) that has been transformed and is running out of the transformer on the secondary side.

PropertyDef.Name: MaximumApparentPower
PropertyDef.Definition: Maximum apparent power/capacity in VA (volt ampere).

PropertyDef.Name: SecondaryCurrentType
PropertyDef.Definition: A list of the secondary current types that can result from transformer output
